Author: jimmybot
Content: How about they start with telling you that it's turned on? I don't see anything in the web interface that tells me that others can also see my live typing.

Author: gaius
Content: In cash terms, that isn't remotely close to true. The chances of making a fortune as the founder of a startup are vanishingly small, and as an employee, a tenth that. Work in an industry such as banking where compensation has a bonus element and you will do better than a hypothetical startup employee who participates in an IPO every year on that alone, and that's before you consider you'll get a good salary and work half as much.

Author: TwoSheds
Content: MindTouch (http://www.mindtouch.com/) competes directly with SharePoint and the base system is open source. Aaron R. Fulkerson from the company creating it was interviewed in FLOSS weekly recently (http://twit.tv/floss89) Sounded pretty cool, and certainly worth a look if you have any doubts about introducing yet another lock-in to Microsoft platform.

Author: gojomo
Content:
I've downloaded the Shazam iPhone app -- and have always been disappointed with the results.

When Shazam was featured in an iPhone commercial, I actually tried identifying the exact music in the commercial with Shazam. Couldn't get it to work on multiple tries (replaying the commercial online).

I hope some of those 10 million lookie-loos had better luck than I did.

Author: DuncanIdaho
Content:
Atlassian Confluence or whole Atlassian suite.

Which does most of the stuff done by SharePoint much better (office integration is obviously much better on SP). Also you can get pretty impressive Confluence/Sharepoint integration.

Also if you're already using Domino platform in house - you could go the Lotus Connections + Quickr way - getting full Open Office (Symphony) integration.

Both these solutions being much cheaper AND more extensible than SharePoint. Plus collaboration capabilities of Atlassian or IBM solutions being much better than SP's

Don't get me wrong - I believe that SP is pretty good - just not for an IT company with tech savvy users - it would be probably better to look somewhere else.

Author: chanux
Content:
I see your point. But still there are times that people submit dupes just because they do not know. I think they need a little help (I'm in this category).

Yes the humans filter well. But loads of links on new submissions page drags things out of attention of humans. Dupe links only help very little in this case. But spam does. I don't know why I see so many mozilla start page submissions in new submissions page (for example).

Author: manish
Content: May be a flag duplicate will help. Its easier for us to tell some duplicate post which comes as blog, different url, different site etc, compared to filters.

Author: ghotli
Content:
I'd say if the dupe hasn't been submitted in a long while then it should be accepted. A link should be added to the story pointing to the old discussion thread for that link.

This way if the community finds an old topic/link interesting again for some reason there can be a lively discussion with participants that may not have been around previously.

Author: petermarks
Content: Agreed. I thought the most spine tingling part of the trilogy was at the end of the second movie when Neo uses his powers in the real world. This is reminiscent of my own hacking experience, albiet far less dramatic, where successfully gaming the rules of one system gave me a whole new perspective and level of confidence to manipulate another system. It helps to broaden your horizons, so long as you eventually hone in on one thing and give it all you got.
